ovdesc.p: Industry codes are defined on this table and assigned to each Customer record to identify the industry in which the Customer is trading. If a Customer is trading in various types of industries only his main one should be specified.
This will enable reports to be produced to provide information on the industries that the bank is financing and analyse the risk within them.

A default Industry code can be linked to a Sector code on the Customer Defaults table. When this Sector code is Input on the Customer record the associated Industry code will then be retrieved automatically.
Up to 9999 Industry codes may be specified.

desc.p: Describes the Industry and is used for enrichment of the Code.

This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the Description of the Industry code in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE table (Ref: GENERAL TABLES) and will indicate to the User the Language in which the Description must be entered.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. Multivalue field. (Mandatory input)
Indicates whether this industry is considered High Risk.
This is the code by which this Industry can be identified.
The Code must be in the range 1-9999 and represents the ID of the table.
